entries.meaning: A cart designed to be pulled or pushed by hand (as opposed to with a beast of burden.)
examples: Vendors were selling sunglasses, bagged snacks, and sundry other items from handcarts in the square.

verbs.description: handcart (third-person singular simple present handcarts, present participle handcarting, simple past and past participle handcarted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To transport in this kind of cart.
